titleproper.value:
Guide to the John A. Coke Papers
                    <lb/>(Records of the Confederate army enrolling office for the Third Congressional District of Virginia)
                    <lb/> 1861-1865
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MS670.6</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Susan Kriete. Machine readable finding aid created by Susan Kriete.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2014-04-16T11:20-0400</date>

unittitle.value:
John A. Coke Papers
                <lb/>(Records of the Confederate army enrolling office for the Third Congressional District of Virginia)
                <lb/>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value:
This collection contains correspondence and official documents relating to John A. Coke's work as the enrolling officer for the Confederate army in the Third Congressional District of Virginia, headquartered in Richmond, Virginia. It includes papers relating to enrollment, conscription, exemptions, substitutes, detail assignments, and other documents concerning the availability of men for service in the Confederate army. The materials in this collection have been digitized and are available online to on-site researchers and to users affiliated with subscribing institutions via 
                <extref ns2:href="http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&db=h5c&bquery=(HJ+FBG8)&type=1&site=ehost-live">EBSCOhost</extref>.

p.value: Items that include presidential signatures will be presented to researchers in duplicate form.
This collection should be cited as the John A. Coke Papers, MS 670.6, The New-York Historical Society.

The materials in this collection have been digitized and are available online to on-site researchers and to users affiliated with subscribing institutions via 
                <extref ns2:href="http://search.ebscohost.com/login.aspx?direct=true&db=h5c&bquery=(HJ+FBG8)&type=1&site=ehost-live">EBSCOhost</extref>.
